page.title: 02FARMING IN THE SUCKLEY AREA
page.content:
{
The area is one of Old Red Sandstone and clay and is noted for its outstanding beauty. It has had the reputation of being a hop and soft fruit growing area, but this has changed dramatically within the last ten years. There are now only two farms which produce hops, Winthill and Stocks farms. Many apple orchards have been replaced by cereals, root vegetables and soft fruit for the 'pick your Own' market. The cherry orchards, growing Red and White Hearts, Waterloo and Wellingtons, are coming to the end of a profitable life and will not be replaced. Stocks Farm at Suckley has eleven acres of vines of the Muller-Thurgan variety. There are 15,000 vines, which are bottled as Stocks Riesling Sylvaner.
